oai_dc:dc.dc:title: General Grant and Staff on Lookout Mountain, 1863
Grant at scene of the "Battle above the Clouds"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: General Ulysses S. Grant on Lookout Mountain near Missionary Ridge in 1863. Four men in uniform pose near the edge of the cliff, while one sits further back on the path. The other four are identified, left to right, as General John A. Rawlins, General J. D. Webster, Colonel Clark B. Lagow, and Colonel Killyer.

In September 1863, the Union brigade holding Chattanooga since that summer was sequestered by Confederate General James Longstreet's troops. General Grant seized Brown’s Ferry as well as Wauhatchie, opening up a supply line to the beleaguered Union troops. General Hooker then attacked Lookout Mountain in what became known as "The Battle above the Clouds” on November 25.
